result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darren K Donlan

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Darren K Donlan appeared by video via Zoom.  Attorney Ryan Kohler appeared on behalf of Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond in court for Darren K Donlan. Attorney Kohler states the defense is waiting on discovery and requests a new return date.

Defendant is to appear in person at the next hearing. Fingerprinting is needed.
Hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 2:32 PM.
Defendant Darren K Donlan appeared by video, in custody from the LaCrosse County Jail.  Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond in court for Darren K Donlan.  Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 8/29/22 at 3:30 PM.
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Dated 08/09/2022, Letter from Attorney Ryan Raymond to Court requesting remote appearance for defendant.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Order Approving Rescheduling of Preliminary Hearing
Dated 08/01/2022 from ADA Afton Lewis to Court regarding request to reschedule the Preliminary Hearing from August 16, 2022 to August 9, 2022 for witness availability.

Conditions:
No contact with E.D. or E.D.'s residence. 
Comply with any restraining orders that may be in place.

(11:12 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Darren K Donlan appeared by video, in custody in the La Crosse County Jail without counsel.
Court orders the warrant is quashed.
Defendant is advised of charges and potential penalties.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with E.D. or E.D.'s residence. 
Comply with any restraining orders that may be in place.
